TopicTitle: [1.2] & [1.1.3] | Official Release of Kerbal Galaxy Revamped | [PROJECT SCRAPPED]

Articles.Content:

thanks
I haven't been to this Forum post for a long time but, if you're upgrading to 1.2, may I suggest you fix the starlight (if possible) whenever it's alright for you to work? Thanks.

@Galileo

Sir, I know this is not your mod, but, I tried this with clean installation of 1.2 + kopernicus, everything is ok, but as soon as i add scatterer, there comes a very nasty memory leak (the picture, the arrow shows when the ksc scene opens) as soon as we switch to command center or inside any other building, the memory gets freed in few seconds, knowing that you have some mod related to planet systems, and you had scatterer settings, can you please help us here to understand what is the problem with scatterer? thanks

http://prntscr.com/cxkpqq

10 minutes ago, Jiraiyah said:

@Galileo

Sir, I know this is not your mod, but, I tried this with clean installation of 1.2 + kopernicus, everything is ok, but as soon as i add scatterer, there comes a very nasty memory leak (the picture, the arrow shows when the ksc scene opens) as soon as we switch to command center or inside any other building, the memory gets freed in few seconds, knowing that you have some mod related to planet systems, and you had scatterer settings, can you please help us here to understand what is the problem with scatterer? thanks

http://prntscr.com/cxkpqq

This is my best guess. The reason this happens is because scatterer doesn't load at the main menu. When the KSC scene shows up,  the game loads scatterer so you can expect more ram to be used.  The exact opposite happens when entering the tracking station or any other building,  scatterer is not loaded in those scenes so you will see a drop in memory usage. Hope this helps.

1 minute ago, Galileo said:

This is my best guess. The reason this happens is because scatterer doesn't load at the main menu. When the KSC scene shows up,  the game loads scatterer so you can expect more ram to be used.  The exact opposite happens when entering the tracking station or any other building,  scatterer is not loaded in those scenes so you will see a drop in memory usage. Hope this helps. 

dude, if i leave the game in ksc view, it constantly rise up to eat all my 32 GB of memory !!!!!

it's a memory leak for sure, but when i talked with the mod developer, he said he don't know why it would happen. I thought as a person who had worked with kopernicus and scatterer you may know why a planet system would leak memory side by side with scatterer?

On 11/5/2016 at 9:13 PM, The1pod2 said:

Hello , I have a question, is it normal that the black hole Gargantua shine as a sun ? 

The accretion disk around the black hole can shine. Very efficiently. There is also a visual distortion through a gravitational lens effect which can redirect that shine. some more information on the subject here https://www.quora.com/Do-black-holes-shine-In-the-movie-Interstellar-why-did-it-seem-that-the-black-hole-Gargantua-had-special-type-of-shining-belt

That's the simple answer but if it rotates. Think Wibbly-Wobbly, Timey-Wimey, Spacey-Wacey 

 

Edited November 9, 2016 by nobodyhasthis2
